channel.title: World News Headlines, Latest International News, World Breaking News - Times of India
channel.description: World News: TOI brings the latest world news headlines, Current International breaking news world wide. In depth analysis and top news headlines world wide.

image.title: World News Headlines, Latest International News, World Breaking News - Times of India

item.title: When Kamala Harris' father disapproved of her 'identity politics' in 2019
item.description: A Marxist economist, emeritus professor of Stanford University, Donald J Harris was was made a senior economic advisor of the Jamaican government in the early 1990s. But now Donald J Harris stays in Washington DC, near to the White House with Carol Kirlew, Kamala Harris' step mother. Donald J Harris wanted to stay out of the political hullabaloo but this campaign, he is being dragged every time Kamala Harris' ethnicity, political leaning is on the radar.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: State representative Shawn Thierry switches to Republican Party after primary defeat
item.description: Texas State Representative Shawn Thierry has decided to switch parties and join the Republicans after being defeated in the Democratic primary for her Houston seat. Thierry has criticised the Democratic Party for its stance on issues like gender transition for minors and changes to Title IX. Governor Greg Abbott and House Speaker Dade Phelan welcomed the move. Her term ends on January 14, with her successor to be decided in the November 5 election.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: 2 things Kamala Harris doing for debate preparation: Remain calm and...
item.description: ​Kamala Harris has been asked to remain calm and instead focus on talking about Donald Trump's presidency. Harris may bring up issues like Trump's response to Covid pandemic, failure to get Mexico to pay for the southern border wall etc. Her team is preparing herself for situation when Trump attacks her personally, but she has to sidestep that. Harris' team also plans to emphasize on Trump's advanced age and lack of details on policy proposals.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Did Barron Trump say he earned respect of those willing to sacrifice for the country?
item.description: A screenshot claiming to show a message from Barron Trump, asserting he has earned the respect of those willing to sacrifice for the country, is not from an official account. Trump spokesperson and Melania Trump's office confirmed that Barron has no active social media presence and did not make such a statement. The post appears on an account named “Barron Trump New,” which is not affiliated with the Trump campaign.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Who is shaman Durek Verret, Norway's clairvoyant princess is getting married to?
item.description: African-American shaman Durek Verrett believes cancer is a choice and has once recommended some exercises to remove imprints from women's vaginas left by previous partners. The Hollywood's shaman will be the husband to Norway's princess Martha Louise who is a clairvoyant and teaches students to do miracles, talk to angels.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Nasa removes two astronauts from Space X flight to accommodate Sunita Williams and Butch Wilmore stranded at ISS
item.description: Nasa plans to remove two astronauts from a SpaceX mission to make room for two ISS astronauts, Sunita Williams and Butch Wilmore, who will return early due to safety concerns with their Boeing Starliner capsule. The adjustments ensure their February return with Nick Hague and Aleksandr Gorbunov, while other astronauts are deferred to future flights. The agency said that factors such as spaceflight experience were considered in making this decision.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Stepping out of office for coffee? This Australian company doesn't allow
item.description: An Australian mining firm faces backlash over claims by managing director Chris Ellison that coffee breaks are too expensive. Ellison wants employees kept in the office all day and criticizes remote work costs. The Perth-based office includes various amenities to encourage on-site work. The policy is part of a broader industry trend against remote work. Last week, the head of London-based smartphone maker Nothing declared a shift to fully office-based work, ending their hybrid model.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Strangers lock crying child in plane's bathroom in China: 'Won't let you out unless...'
item.description: Two women, irritated by a crying child on a Juneyao Airlines flight, took the child from her grandmother and locked her in the restroom. The incident, which occurred on August 24 and was filmed by one of the women, led to public outrage when posted on social media. The airline later apologized for the crew's negligence.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Vivek Ramaswamy says he gets why Kamala Harris replaced Biden. Elon Musk agrees
item.description: ​"Kamala’s interview last night was a reminder that we’re not running against a candidate. We’re running against a *system*. They require a candidate they can control, which means having original ideas is a disqualification. That’s exactly why we get Biden, then Kamala, and so on," Vivek wrote on X. Elon Musk who openly endorsed Donald Trump agreed to Vivek Ramaswamy's theory.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: 'Hawk Tuah Girl' launches 'dream' animal foundation after viral fame
item.description: Hailey Welch, famed as 'Hawk Tuah Girl,' has started her animal foundation, Paws Across America. Announced on social media, the 22-year-old seeks to aid animal charities across the US with awareness, advocacy, and financial help. Welch showcased her initial visit to a Tennessee animal shelter, with her video gaining ample attention online. She shares intentions to leverage her popularity and resources to support animals, emphasising adoption. Welch's announcement quickly gained traction, with her video amassing over 260,000 views on X and nearly 700,000 on Instagram.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Russian attack on playground, residential building kills at least 4 in Ukraine
item.description: In Kharkiv, a Russian guided bomb hit a residential area, killing at least six people, including a child, and injuring more than 28. Mayor Ihor Terekhov detailed the tragic incident, emphasizing the loss on a playground. President Volodymyr Zelenskyy urged Western allies to authorize long-range strikes on Russian military air bases to deter future attacks.
item.dc:creator: TOI News Desk

item.title: Chaos at Disney World Florida: Fight and balloon pop sparks active shooter rumours
item.description: Mass panic erupted at Walt Disney World’s Magic Kingdom in Florida after a fight and the sound of a popping balloon led to false rumors of an active shooter. The chaos occurred around 10 pm as the park closed. Authorities quickly clarified there was no active shooter, and normal operations resumed shortly afterwards.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Tragic! NHL star Johnny Gaudreau, brother killed by car in New Jersey, day before sister's wedding
item.description: Columbus Blue Jackets player Johnny Gaudreau and his brother Matthew died in a biking accident in New Jersey, allegedly involving a drunk driver. The driver has been arrested. Gaudreau's team issued a heartfelt statement. Johnny Gaudreau was an established NHL player with a lengthy career including nine seasons with the Calgary Flames before joining the Blue Jackets.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Who is Barry Stanton whose anti-Indian posts led to his ban on X?
item.description: The X account of Barry Stanton, with a verified status and over 1.8 lakh followers, was suspended after Indian users raised alarms about its offensive content towards Indian immigrants and other ethnicities. The account had been on the platform since before Twitter rebranded as X, and its authenticity remains ambiguous with speculation that it might have been a parody.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Did Kamala Harris work at a McDonald's? Why does it matter?
item.description: Republicans accuse Kamala Harris of fabricating her first employment at McDonald's, saying that it was not mentioned on her 1987 resume for a law clerk job. They claim this information remained missing from all aspects of Harris' life, from her biographies too until she ran for president in 2019. Democrats dismiss the claim and said it was just a summer job -- not worthy to find its place in the CV.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Why Conservative leader Pierre Poilievre called NDP's Jagmeet Singh ‘Sellout Singh’
item.description: "Canadians can't afford or even endure another year of this costly coalition. No one voted for you to keep Trudeau in power. You do not have a mandate to drag out his government another year," Poilievre stated in his letter. "Pull out of the costly coalition and vote non-confidence in the government this September to trigger a carbon tax election in October of THIS YEAR. Or you will forever be known as 'Sellout Singh,'" Poilievre added.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Boeing, Nasa executives yelled at heated meetings over how to bring back astronauts: 'If there's failure...'
item.description: If there's a catastrophe, the headlines won't blame Boeing for killing two astronauts, they will say 'Nasa killed two astronauts', a Nasa executive said explaining how they picked Elon Musk's SpaceX for bringing Suni Williams and Butch Wilmore after several rounds of meetings between Nasa and Boeing which turned heated with a lot of yelling at each other.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: 'Trump's presidency might put Taiwan's security at risk', say Taiwanese Americans
China: Two women lock crying toddler in plane's washroom to educate child
item.description: Two women locked a crying toddler in the washroom during a flight in China with the grandmother’s consent, aiming to calm the child and avoid disturbing other passengers. Despite intentions to help, the act sparked significant online backlash and debates on how to handle crying children in public. The incident was confirmed by Juneyao Airlines.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Heathrow airport border staff announce new strike
item.description: Hundreds of Border Force officers at London Heathrow are set to strike for four days starting Saturday over working conditions related to inflexible rosters. Around 650 members will also refuse overtime for 18 days from September 4. The union cites stress and long hours, while the government aims to minimize travel disruption and continue talks with the union.
